TITLE: Convert Presentation to PDF using Aspose.Slides in Java
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to convert a PowerPoint presentation (PPTX) to a PDF file using the Aspose.Slides for Java API. It instantiates a Presentation object, loads the PPTX file, and saves it as a PDF using the SaveFormat.Pdf option. It also includes a try-finally block to ensure that the Presentation object is properly disposed of to release resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aspose-slides/aspose.slides-for-java/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
// instantiate a Presentation object that represents a presentation file
Presentation pres = new Presentation("demo.pptx");
try {
    // save the presentation to PDF with default options
    pres.save("output.pdf", SaveFormat.Pdf);
} finally {
    if (pres != null) pres.dispose();
}
```

TITLE: Create Presentation from Scratch using Aspose.Slides in Java
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to create a PowerPoint presentation from scratch using the Aspose.Slides for Java API.  It instantiates a Presentation object, accesses the first slide, adds an AutoShape of Rectangle type with text, and customizes the text color and shape style. Finally, it saves the presentation as a PPTX file. A try-finally block ensures proper resource disposal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aspose-slides/aspose.slides-for-java/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Java
CODE:
```
// instantiate Presentation
Presentation pres = new Presentation();
try {
    // get the first slide
    ISlide sld = (ISlide) pres.getSlides().get_Item(0);
    
    // add an AutoShape of Rectangle type
    IAutoShape ashp = sld.getShapes().addAutoShape(ShapeType.Rectangle, 150, 75, 150, 50);
    
    // add ITextFrame to the Rectangle
    ashp.addTextFrame("Hello World");
    
    // change the text color to Black (which is White by default)
    ashp.getTextFrame().getParagraphs().get_Item(0).getPortions().get_Item(0).getPortionFormat().getFillFormat()
            .setFillType(FillType.Solid);
    ashp.getTextFrame().getParagraphs().get_Item(0).getPortions().get_Item(0).getPortionFormat().getFillFormat()
            .getSolidFillColor().setColor(java.awt.Color.BLACK);
    
    // change the line color of the rectangle to White
    ashp.getShapeStyle().getLineColor().setColor(java.awt.Color.WHITE);
    
    // remove any fill formatting in the shape
    ashp.getFillFormat().setFillType(FillType.NoFill);
    
    // save the presentation to disk
    pres.save("output.pptx", SaveFormat.Pptx);
} finally {
    if (pres != null) pres.dispose();
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Maven Project with Aspose Repository
DESCRIPTION: This snippet configures a Maven project to use Aspose.Slides for Java. It defines the Aspose Maven repository, project properties, and dependencies required to compile and run the project.  It specifies the groupId, artifactId, version, and packaging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aspose-slides/aspose.slides-for-java/blob/master/Plugins/Aspose_Slides_Java_Maven_for_Eclipse/AsposeSlidesEclipsePlugin/resources/pom-xml-template.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
	<groupId>com.mycompany</groupId>
	<artifactId>mavenproject1</artifactId>
	<version>2</version>
	<packaging>jar</packaging>
	<repositories>
		<repository>
			<id>Aspose-Maven-Repository</id>
			<name>Aspose Maven Repository</name>
			<url>https://repository.aspose.com/repo/</url>
		</repository>
	</repositories>
	<properties>
		<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
		<maven.compiler.source>1.7</maven.compiler.source>
		<maven.compiler.target>1.7</maven.compiler.target>
	</properties>
</project>
```

TITLE: Configuring Classpath XML
DESCRIPTION: This XML snippet configures the classpath for a Java project. It specifies source directories (`src/main/java`, `src/main/resources`, `src/test/java`), output directories (`target/classes`, `target/test-classes`), and dependencies (JRE container, Maven classpath container). The `maven.pomderived` attribute indicates that the entries are derived from the Maven POM file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aspose-slides/aspose.slides-for-java/blob/master/Plugins/Aspose_Slides_Java_Maven_for_Eclipse/AsposeSlidesEclipsePlugin/resources/classpath-template.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: XML
CODE:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<classpath>
	<classpathentry kind="src" output="target/classes" path="src/main/java">
		<attributes>
			<attribute name="optional" value="true"/>
			<attribute name="maven.pomderived" value="true"/>
		</attributes>
	</classpathentry>
	<classpathentry excluding="**" kind="src" output="target/classes" path="src/main/resources">
		<attributes>
			<attribute name="maven.pomderived" value="true"/>
		</attributes>
	</classpathentry>	
	<classpathentry kind="src" output="target/test-classes" path="src/test/java">
		<attributes>
			<attribute name="optional" value="true"/>
			<attribute name="maven.pomderived" value="true"/>
		</attributes>
	</classpathentry>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JRE_CONTAINER/org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.launcher.StandardVMType/JavaSE-1.7">
		<attributes>
			<attribute name="maven.pomderived" value="true"/>
		</attributes>
	</classpathentry>
	<classpathentry kind="con" path="org.eclipse.m2e.MAVEN2_CLASSPATH_CONTAINER">
		<attributes>
			<attribute name="maven.pomderived" value="true"/>
		</attributes>
	</classpathentry>
	<classpathentry kind="output" path="target/classes"/>
</classpath>
```

TITLE: Setup Package with Setuptools in Python
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet uses the setuptools library to define the setup configuration for a Python package. It specifies the package name, version, description, author, URL, and classifiers. The `find_packages()` function automatically discovers all packages and subpackages to be included in the distribution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aspose-slides/aspose.slides-for-java/blob/master/Plugins/Aspose-Slides-Java-for-Python/untitled text 5.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Python
CODE:
```
from setuptools import setup, find_packages

setup(
    name = 'aspose-slides-java-for-python',
    packages = find_packages(),
    version = '1.0',
    description = 'Aspose.Slides Java for Python is a project that demonstrates / provides the Aspose.Slides for Java API usage examples in Python.',
    author='Fahad Adeel',
    author_email='slides@aspose.com',
    url='http://www.aspose.com/docs/display/slidesjava/Aspose.Slides+Java+for+Python',
    classifiers=[
        'Programming Language :: Python',
        'Programming Language :: Python :: 2',
        'License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License',
        'Operating System :: OS Independent'
    ]
)
```

TITLE: Using Aspose.Slides in Ruby with RJB
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to load and initialize the Aspose.Slides library in Ruby using the Ruby Java Bridge (RJB). It includes requiring the necessary files, including the AsposeSlidesJava module, and initializing the libraries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/aspose-slides/aspose.slides-for-java/blob/master/Plugins/Aspose_Slides_Java_for_Ruby/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: ruby
CODE:
```
require File.dirname(File.dirname(File.dirname(__FILE__))) + '/lib/asposeslidesjava'
include Asposeslidesjava
include Asposeslidesjava::HelloWorld
initialize_aspose_slides
```

```

```
